description: A Helm chart to template the manifest of a Cloud Run service or job.

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command.

maxConcurrentRequests.description: The number of concurrent requests per instance. Controls how many requests are processed before the autoscaler scales up. Setting this to 1 means 1 request per instance at a time.

maxScale.description: Maximum number of replicas to scale up to.

minScale.description: Minimum number of replicas to scale down to. 0 enables scale to zero.

command.description: Command to run in the container.

containerPort.description: Container port to expose. In CloudRun only a single port can be exposed and defaults to 8080.

description.description: A human-readable description of the CloudRun service.

env.description: Environment variables to set in the CloudRun container.

executionEnvironment.description: The execution environment to use for the CloudRun container. Must be either 'gen2' or 'gen1'.

image.description: Container image to deploy. You can provide a direct reference to an image or split up the inputs.

tag.description: Container image tag. For example, 'latest' or '@sha256:abc123'.

ingress.description: The ingress settings for the CloudRun service. Controls where the service can be accessed from.

labels.description: Labels to add to the CloudRun container. Must conform to the CloudRun label schema.

launchStage.description: The launch stage of the CloudRun service. Controls feature availability and SLA.

livenessProbe.description: Configuration for liveness probe health checking.

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failures before considering the container unhealthy.

path.description: Path to probe for HTTP health check.

port.description: Port to probe for HTTP health check.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before starting probe checks.

periodSeconds.description: How often to perform probe checks.

name.description: Name of the CloudRun  resource to deploy. Truncated to 63 characters.

readinessProbe.description: Configuration for readiness probe health checking.

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failures before considering the container not ready.

path.description: Path to probe for HTTP health check.

port.description: Port to probe for HTTP health check.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before starting probe checks.

periodSeconds.description: How often to perform probe checks.

resources.description: Resource requests and limits for the CloudRun container. If not provided, defaults are used.

cpuThrottling.description: Whether to throttle the CPU. This has significant impact on billing.

cpu.description: Maximum CPUs to allocate for the CloudRun container. Can be 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, or any fractional value from 0.01 to 1.

memory.description: Maximum memory to allocate for the CloudRun container. Requires a minimum number of CPUs of 2 over 4GiB.

startupBoost.description: Whether to boost the CPUs at the start of the container.

serviceAccountName.description: Service account to use to run the CloudRun container. If not provided, the default service account of the project is used.

sessionAffinity.description: Whether to enable session affinity for the CloudRun service. When enabled, requests from the same client are routed to the same container instance.

startupProbe.description: Configuration for startup probe health checking.

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failures before considering the startup failed.

path.description: Path to probe for HTTP health check.

port.description: Port to probe for HTTP health check.

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds to wait before starting probe checks.

periodSeconds.description: How often to perform probe checks.

timeoutSeconds.description: The maximum time the container will wait before responding with a 504 error.

type.description: Type of CloudRun resource to deploy. Must be either 'service' or 'job'.

connector.description: Name of the VPC connector to use for the CloudRun container. Uses a serverless VPC access connector. Cannot be used with network.

egress.description: Name of the VPC egress to use for the CloudRun container.

network.description: Name of the VPC network to use to create a direct VPC connection. Must be used tohether with subnetwork. Cannot be used with connector.

subnetwork.description: Name of the VPC subnetwork to use to create a direct VPC connection. Must be used together with network. Cannot be used with connector.

title: CloudRun Helm Chart
